Amateur Registration
Mixed Proficiency Registration

Confused?

If we lose you anywhere, our friendly guide for newcomers may be useful.

What can I enter? What's it cost?

For amateur couples, we offer 5 levels: Newcomer, Bronze, Advanced Bronze, Silver, and Gold/Open. For mixed proficiency couples, there is only 1 level. In all amateur levels and MP, we offer these single-dance events:

Smooth Standard
  • Waltz
  • Tango
  • Foxtrot
  • Viennese Waltz
  • Waltz
  • Tango
  • Viennese Waltz
  • Foxtrot
  • Quickstep
Rhythm Latin
  • Cha Cha
  • Rumba
  • Swing
  • Bolero
  • Mambo
  • Samba
  • Cha Cha
  • Rumba
  • Paso Doble
  • Jive

Pricing

Competitor package: $40 per person for up to 8 entries.

  • Competitor package: up to 8 amateur event entries for $40 per person. Includes a program and admission to the ballroom for both the day session and the evening Halloween Ball.
  • Your first mixed proficiency event is free--program and admission to the Halloween Ball in the evening not included.
  • More than one MP event = $40 competitor package (see above).
  • MP events are always free for the more proficient partner.

Limits

Here's how your entries are limited:

  • Each person may enter any event only once.
  • Each person may enter up to 8 amateur events.
  • You may only dance 1 mixed proficiency event with a given partner.
  • You may not dance mixed proficiency and amateur with the same partner.

Destination

Saint Paul Student Center
2017 Buford Ave
Saint Paul MN 55108
(In the North Star Ballroom) (Map)

Schedule (this may change a bit)

Day Session

8:30 AM: Welcome! Registration
9:00 AM: Latin and Rhythm
12:10 PM: Lunch Break
1:30 PM: Standard and Smooth
5:00 PM: End of Day Session. Dinner Break

Evening Session

6:30 PM: Halloween Ball - General Dancing, Evening Show
10:00 PM: Good Night!

Minnesota Ballroom Blast is

low-stress, feedback-based, and designed to:

  • Provide social dancers and competitors alike with meaningful feedback from professionals they might not otherwise have access to
  • Introduce beginners to the general format of a competition in a low-chaos environment
  • Provide a preparatory event for those looking to compete
  • Allow couples to experiment with new choreography and costuming

Questions? Contact Us.

If you have any questions or need any assistance, please e-mail us at info@upartnerdance.org.
